verbs.description: PARIS — France [V: is] sternly rejecting U.S. President Donald Trump 's argument that if Parisians had more guns they could have stopped the deadly 2015 extremist attacks on the French capital .

[ARGM-DIS: PARIS] — [ARG0: France] is [ARGM-MNR: sternly] [V: rejecting] [ARG1: U.S. President Donald Trump 's argument that if Parisians had more guns they could have stopped the deadly 2015 extremist attacks on the French capital] .

PARIS — France is sternly rejecting U.S. President Donald Trump 's argument that if [ARG0: Parisians] [V: had] [ARG1: more guns] they could have stopped the deadly 2015 extremist attacks on the French capital .
PARIS — France is sternly rejecting U.S. President Donald Trump 's argument that if Parisians had more guns they [V: could] have stopped the deadly 2015 extremist attacks on the French capital .
PARIS — France is sternly rejecting U.S. President Donald Trump 's argument that if Parisians had more guns they could [V: have] stopped the deadly 2015 extremist attacks on the French capital .

PARIS — France is sternly rejecting U.S. President Donald Trump 's argument that [ARGM-ADV: if Parisians had more guns] [ARG0: they] [ARGM-MOD: could] have [V: stopped] [ARG1: the deadly 2015 extremist attacks on the French capital] .
